intro: Gypsocallis manipuliflora, commonly known as the manipuliflorous gypsocallis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
